alert.note: Alert for Catoosa; Dade; Fannin; Murray; Walker; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Catoosa, northeastern Murray, Whitfield, Walker, central Dade and northwestern Fannin Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 300 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Red Clay S.p. to near Sulpher Springs, and moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dalton, Lafayette, Ringgold, Fort Oglethorpe, Chickamauga, Varnell, Tunnel Hill, Cohutta, Sumac, Gregory, Blue Spring, Cohutta Wilderness, Fairview, Beaverdale, Chattanooga Valley, Cloudland Canyon State Park, Cooper Heights, Rock Spring, Naomi and Rising Fawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Catoosa; Dade; Fannin; Murray; Walker; Whitfield
